content:
Following is the structure requirements of a VTT file.

An optional byte order mark (BOM).The string “WEBVTT”.An optional text header to the right of WEBVTT.A blank line, which is equivalent to two consecutive newlines.Zero or more cues or comments.Zero or more blank lines.

description: A VTT file is a text file that contains information for displaying timed text tracks (such as subtitles or captions) using the Web Video Text Tracks (WebVTT) format. The timed text tracks includes information such as subtitles or captions. The purpose of VTT file is to add text overlays to a . The format is somewhat similar to the SRT files. WebVTT based text files are encoded using UTF-8. A VTT file contains information such as subtitles, descriptions, captions, descriptions, chapters, and metadata. Being plain text files, VTT files can be opened using text editors such as Microsoft Notepad, Apple TextEdit, and Notepad++.
